Location of Administration of BCG Vaccine
Were there shortages/stockouts of the vaccine?

column3: Because of the high incidence of TB in Austria, BCG vaccination of all newborns was implemented in 1952. In the following decades, TB-incidence declined to few cases annually. During the last few years the BCG policy was in effect, several cases of side effects occurred, partly severe. So, the expert panel decided to stop the BCG vaccination programme as of December 31, 1989.
